pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā udāyī sāvatthiyaṃ kulūpako hoti. Bahukāni kulāni upasaṅkamati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.2.eng: Venerable Udāyī was associating with and visiting a number of families in Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.3.pli: Yattha passati kumārakaṃ vā apajāpatikaṃ, kumārikaṃ vā apatikaṃ, kumārakassa mātāpitūnaṃ santike kumārikāya vaṇṇaṃ bhaṇati—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.3.eng: When Udāyī saw a young man without a wife and a young woman without a husband, he would praise the young woman to the parents of the young man,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.3.comm: The Pali reads yattha passati kumārakaṁ vā apajāpatikaṁ kumārikaṁ vā apatikaṁ kumārakassa, literally, “When Udāyi saw a young man without a wife or a young woman without a husband”. However, since the “or” gives an awkward meaning in English, I have replaced it with “and”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.4.pli: “amukassa kulassa kumārikā abhirūpā dassanīyā pāsādikā paṇḍitā byattā medhāvinī dakkhā analasā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.4.eng: “The young woman of such-and-such a family is beautiful, intelligent, skilled, and diligent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.7.pli: “ete kho, bhante, amhe na jānanti—‘ke vā ime kassa vā’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.7.eng: “They don’t know who we are, venerable.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.8.pli: Sace, bhante, ayyo dāpeyya āneyyāma mayaṃ taṃ kumārikaṃ imassa kumārakassā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.8.eng: If you could persuade them to give the girl, we would take her for our son.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.9.pli: Kumārikāya mātāpitūnaṃ santike kumārakassa vaṇṇaṃ bhaṇati—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.9.eng: And he praised the young man to the parents of the young woman,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.10.pli: “amukassa kulassa kumārako abhirūpo dassanīyo pāsādiko paṇḍito byatto medhāvī dakkho analaso.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.10.eng: “The young man of such-and-such a family is handsome, intelligent, skilled, and diligent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.13.pli: “ete kho, bhante, amhe na jānanti—‘ke vā ime kassa vā’ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.13.eng: “They don’t know who we are, venerable,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.14.eng: and we would be ashamed to speak to them for the sake of the girl.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.15.pli: Sace, bhante, ayyo yācāpeyya dajjeyyāma mayaṃ imaṃ kumārikaṃ tassa kumārakassā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.15.eng: But if you could persuade them to ask us, we would give our girl to the young man.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.16.pli: Eteneva upāyena āvāhānipi kārāpeti, vivāhānipi kārāpeti, vāreyyānipi kārāpeti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.1.16.eng: In this way he arranged for the taking of a bride, for the giving of a bride, and for marriage.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarissā purāṇagaṇakiyā dhītā abhirūpā hoti dassanīyā pāsādikā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.1.eng: At that time there was a former courtesan who had a beautiful daughter.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.2.pli: Tirogāmakā ājīvakasāvakā āgantvā taṃ gaṇakiṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.2.eng: On one occasion some lay followers of the Ājīvaka religion came from another village and said to that courtesan,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.3.eng: “Ma’am, please give your girl to our boy.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.4.pli: Sā evamāha—“ahaṃ khvayyo, tumhe na jānāmi—‘ke vā ime kassa vā’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.4.eng: “I don’t know who you are, sirs,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.5.pli: Ayañca me ekadhītikā, tirogāmo ca gantabbo, nāhaṃ dassāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.5.eng: and I won’t give my only daughter to be taken to another village.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.6.eng: People asked those Ājīvaka lay followers

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.8.pli: “Idha mayaṃ, ayyo, amukaṃ nāma gaṇakiṃ dhītaraṃ yācimhā amhākaṃ kumārakassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.8.eng: They replied, “We came to ask that courtesan to give her daughter to our son,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.9.pli: Sā evamāha—‘ahaṃ khvayyo, tumhe na jānāmi—ke vā ime kassa vā’ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.10.pli: Ayañca me ekadhītikā, tirogāmo ca gantabbo, nāhaṃ dassāmī”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.11.pli: “Kissa tumhe, ayyo, taṃ gaṇakiṃ dhītaraṃ yācittha?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.11.eng: “But why did you ask the courtesan?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.12.eng: You should speak to Venerable Udāyī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.14.pli: Atha kho te ājīvakasāvakā yenāyasmā udāyī tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.14.eng: They then went to Udāyī and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.15.pli: “idha mayaṃ, bhante, amukaṃ nāma gaṇakiṃ dhītaraṃ yācimhā amhākaṃ kumārakassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.15.eng: “Venerable, we’ve asked that courtesan here to give her daughter to our son,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.16.pli: Sā evamāha—‘ahaṃ khvayyo, tumhe na jānāmi—ke vā ime kassa vāti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.17.pli: Ayañca me ekadhītikā, tirogāmo ca gantabbo, nāhaṃ dassāmī’ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.18.pli: Sādhu, bhante, ayyo taṃ gaṇakiṃ dhītaraṃ dāpetu amhākaṃ kumārakassā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.18.eng: Would you please persuade her to give her daughter?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.19.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī yena sā gaṇakī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā taṃ gaṇakiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.19.eng: Udāyī agreed. Soon afterwards he went to that courtesan and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.20.eng: “Why didn’t you give them your daughter?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.21.pli: “Ahaṃ khvayya, ime na jānāmi—‘ke vā ime kassa vā’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.21.eng: “I don’t know who they are, sir,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.22.pli: Ayañca me ekadhītikā, tirogāmo ca gantabbo, nāhaṃ dassāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.22.eng: and I won’t give my only daughter to be taken to another village.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.2.25.eng: “If you know them, I’ll give her away.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.1.pli: Atha kho sā gaṇakī tesaṃ ājīvakasāvakānaṃ dhītaraṃ adāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.1.eng: She then gave her daughter to those Ājīvaka followers,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.2.pli: Atha kho te ājīvakasāvakā taṃ kumārikaṃ netvā māsaṃyeva suṇisabhogena bhuñjiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.2.eng: and they took her away. For a month they treated her like a daughter-in-law,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.4.pli: Atha kho sā kumārikā mātuyā santike dūtaṃ pāhesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.4.eng: The girl sent a message to her mother, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.6.eng: For a month they treated me like a daughter-in-law,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.8.eng: Come, mom, and take me home.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.9.pli: Atha kho sā gaṇakī yena te ājīvakasāvakā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā te ājīvakasāvake etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.9.eng: Soon afterwards the courtesan went to those Ājīvakas and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.10.eng: “Please don’t treat my girl like a slave;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.13.pli: “natthamhākaṃ tayā saddhiṃ āhārūpahāro, samaṇena saddhiṃ amhākaṃ āhārūpahāro,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.13.eng: “We deal with the monastic, not with you.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.15.eng: We don’t want anything to do with you.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.16.pli: Atha kho sā gaṇakī tehi ājīvakasāvakehi apasāditā punadeva sāvatthiṃ paccāgañchi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.16.eng: Being dismissed, she returned to Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.17.pli: Dutiyampi kho sā kumārikā mātuyā santike dūtaṃ pāhesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.17.eng: A second time the girl sent the same message to her mother.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.22.pli: Atha kho sā gaṇakī yenāyasmā udāyī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.22.eng: That courtesan then went to Udāyī and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.23.pli: “sā kira, bhante, kumārikā duggatā dukkhitā, na sukhaṃ labhati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.23.eng: “Venerable, my girl is unhappy and miserable.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.24.eng: They treated her like a daughter-in-law for a month,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.29.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī yena te ājīvakasāvakā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā te ājīvakasāvake etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.29.eng: Udāyī went to the Ājīvakas and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.30.eng: “Please don’t treat this girl like a slave;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.33.pli: “natthamhākaṃ tayā saddhiṃ āhārūpahāro, gaṇakiyā saddhiṃ amhākaṃ āhārūpahāro.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.33.eng: “We deal with the courtesan, not with you.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.35.eng: You should behave like a proper monastic.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.37.eng: We don’t want anything to do with you.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.38.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī tehi ājīvakasāvakehi apasādito punadeva sāvatthiṃ paccāgañchi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.38.eng: Being dismissed, he returned to Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.39.pli: Tatiyampi kho sā kumārikā mātuyā santike dūtaṃ pāhesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.39.eng: A third time that girl sent the same message to her mother,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.44.pli: Dutiyampi kho sā gaṇakī yenāyasmā udāyī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.44.eng: and a second time the courtesan went to Udāyī and told him the same thing.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.45.pli: “sā kira, bhante, kumārikā duggatā dukkhitā, na sukhaṃ labhati.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.49.pli: ‘māyyo, imaṃ kumārikaṃ dāsibhogena bhuñjittha, suṇisabhogena imaṃ kumārikaṃ bhuñjathā’”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.3.50.eng: He replied, “When I first went, they just dismissed me.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.4.1.pli: Atha kho sā gaṇakī ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.4.1.eng: Then that courtesan complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.4.2.pli: “evaṃ duggato hotu ayyo udāyī, evaṃ dukkhito hotu ayyo udāyī, evaṃ mā sukhaṃ labhatu ayyo udāyī, yathā me kumārikā duggatā dukkhitā na sukhaṃ labhati pāpikāya sassuyā pāpakena sasurena pāpakena sāmikenā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.4.2.eng: “May Venerable Udāyī be miserable and unhappy, just as my girl is miserable and unhappy because of her nasty mother-in-law, father-in-law, and husband.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.4.3.pli: Sāpi kho kumārikā ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.4.3.eng: The girl, too, complained and criticized him in the same way,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.4.4.pli: “evaṃ duggato hotu ayyo udāyī, evaṃ dukkhito hotu ayyo udāyī, evaṃ mā sukhaṃ labhatu ayyo udāyī, yathāhaṃ duggatā dukkhitā na sukhaṃ labhāmi pāpikāya sassuyā pāpakena sasurena pāpakena sāmikenā”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.4.5.pli: Aññāpi itthiyo asantuṭṭhā sassūhi vā sasurehi vā sāmikehi vā, tā evaṃ oyācanti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.4.5.eng: as did other women who were unhappy with their mothers-in-law, fathers-in-law, and husbands.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.4.6.pli: “evaṃ duggato hotu ayyo udāyī, evaṃ dukkhito hotu ayyo udāyī, evaṃ mā sukhaṃ labhatu ayyo udāyī, yathā mayaṃ duggatā dukkhitā na sukhaṃ labhāma pāpikāhi sassūhi pāpakehi sasurehi pāpakehi sāmikehī”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.4.7.pli: Yā pana tā itthiyo santuṭṭhā sassūhi vā sasurehi vā sāmikehi vā tā evaṃ āyācanti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.4.7.eng: But those women who were happy with their in-laws wished him well, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.4.8.pli: “evaṃ sukhito hotu ayyo udāyī, evaṃ sajjito hotu ayyo udāyī, evaṃ sukhamedho hotu ayyo udāyī, yathā mayaṃ sukhitā sajjitā sukhamedhā bhaddikāhi sassūhi bhaddakehi sasurehi bhaddakehi sāmikehī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.4.8.eng: “May Venerable Udāyī be happy and well, just as we are happy and well because of our good mothers-in-law, fathers-in-law, and husbands.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.5.1.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū ekaccānaṃ itthīnaṃ oyācantīnaṃ ekaccānaṃ itthīnaṃ āyācantīnaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.5.1.eng: The monks heard that some women were criticizing him whereas others were wishing him well.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.5.2.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.5.2.eng: And the monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.5.3.eng: “How can Venerable Udāyī act as a matchmaker?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.5.4.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.5.5.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.5.5.eng: The Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned Udāyī:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.5.6.eng: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.5.9.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, sañcarittaṃ samāpajjissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.5.9.eng: “Foolish man, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.5.11.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.5.11.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.5.12.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu sañcarittaṃ samāpajjeyya, itthiyā vā purisamatiṃ purisassa vā itthimatiṃ, jāyattane vā jārattane vā, saṅghādiseso”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.5.12.1.eng: ‘If a monk acts as a matchmaker, conveying a man’s intention to a woman or a woman’s intention to a man, for marriage or for an affair, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.5.13.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:1.5.13.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā dhuttā uyyāne paricārentā aññatarissā vesiyā santike dūtaṃ pāhesuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.1.eng: Soon afterwards a number of scoundrels who were enjoying themselves in a park sent a messenger to a sex worker, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.2.eng: “Please come, let’s enjoy ourselves in the park.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.4.pli: “ahaṃ khvayyo, tumhe na jānāmi—‘ke vā ime kassa vā’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.4.eng: “Sirs, I don’t know who you are.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.5.eng: I’m wealthy. I don’t want to go outside the city.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.7.pli: Atha kho so dūto tesaṃ dhuttānaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.8.pli: Evaṃ vutte, aññataro puriso te dhutte etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.8.eng: A certain man then said to those men,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.9.eng: “Why did you ask the sex worker?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.10.eng: You should speak to Venerable Udāyī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.12.pli: Evaṃ vutte, aññataro upāsako taṃ purisaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.12.eng: But a certain Buddhist lay follower said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.14.pli: Na kappati samaṇānaṃ sakyaputtiyānaṃ evarūpaṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.14.eng: That’s not allowable for the Sakyan monastics.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.16.eng: And they made a bet on whether he would.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.17.pli: Atha kho te dhuttā yenāyasmā udāyī tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.17.eng: Those scoundrels then went to Udāyī and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.18.pli: “idha mayaṃ, bhante, uyyāne paricārentā asukāya nāma vesiyā santike dūtaṃ pahiṇimhā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.18.eng: “Venerable, while we were enjoying ourselves in the park, we sent a message to such-and-such a sex worker,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.20.pli: Sā evamāha—‘ahaṃ khvayyo, tumhe na jānāmi—ke vā ime kassa vāti,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.23.pli: Sādhu, bhante, ayyo taṃ vesiṃ uyyojetū”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.24.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī yena sā vesī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā taṃ vesiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.24.eng: Udāyī agreed. He then went to that sex worker and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.25.eng: “Why don’t you go to those men?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.26.pli: “Ahaṃ khvayya, ime na jānāmi—‘ke vā ime kassa vā’ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.30.eng: “If you know them, sir, I’ll go.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.31.pli: Atha kho te dhuttā taṃ vesiṃ ādāya uyyānaṃ agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.1.31.eng: And those men took her to the park.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.2.1.pli: Atha kho so upāsako ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.2.1.eng: Then that lay follower complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.2.2.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyo udāyī taṅkhaṇikaṃ sañcarittaṃ samāpajjissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.2.2.eng: “How could Venerable Udāyī act as a matchmaker for a brief affair?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.2.3.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tassa upāsakassa ujjhāyantassa khiyyantassa vipācentassa.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.2.4.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.2.4.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.2.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā udāyī taṅkhaṇikaṃ sañcarittaṃ samāpajjissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.2.5.eng: “How could Venerable Udāyī act as a matchmaker for a brief affair?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.2.6.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.2.6.eng: They rebuked Udāyī in many ways and then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Udāyī:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.2.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, udāyi, taṅkhaṇikaṃ sañcarittaṃ samāpajjasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.2.7.eng: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.2.10.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, taṅkhaṇikaṃ sañcarittaṃ samāpajjissasi?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.2.10.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.2.12.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.2.12.eng: “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.2.13.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu sañcarittaṃ samāpajjeyya, itthiyā vā purisamatiṃ purisassa vā itthimatiṃ, jāyattane vā jārattane vā, antamaso taṅkhaṇikāyapi, saṅghādiseso”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:2.2.13.1.eng: ‘If a monk acts as a matchmaker, conveying a man’s intention to a woman or a woman’s intention to a man, for marriage or for an affair, even if just a brief one, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:3.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:3.6.pli: itthiyā vā pahito purisassa santike gacchati, purisena vā pahito itthiyā santike gacchati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:3.6.eng: sent by a woman he goes to a man, or sent by a man he goes to a woman.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:3.7.eng: A man’s intention to a woman:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:3.8.eng: he informs a woman of a man’s intention.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:3.9.eng: A woman’s intention to a man:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:3.10.eng: he informs a man of a woman’s intention.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:3.15.eng: Even if just a brief one:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:3.17.eng: He commits an offense entailing suspension:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:3.18.eng: … Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.1.1.pli: Dasa itthiyo— māturakkhitā piturakkhitā mātāpiturakkhitā bhāturakkhitā bhaginirakkhitā ñātirakkhitā gottarakkhitā dhammarakkhitā sārakkhā saparidaṇḍā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.1.1.eng: There are ten kinds of women: the one protected by her mother, the one protected by her father, the one protected by her parents, the one protected by her brother, the one protected by her sister, the one protected by her relatives, the one protected by her family, the one protected by her religion, the one otherwise protected, the one protected by the threat of punishment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.1.2.pli: Dasa bhariyāyo— dhanakkītā chandavāsinī bhogavāsinī paṭavāsinī odapattakinī obhaṭacumbaṭā dāsī ca bhariyā ca kammakārī ca bhariyā ca dhajāhaṭā muhuttikā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.1.2.eng: There are ten kinds of wives: the bought wife, the wife by choice, the wife through property, the wife through clothes, the wife through the bowl-of-water ritual, the wife through removing the head pad, the slave wife, the servant wife, the captured wife, the momentary wife.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.1.eng: The one protected by her mother:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.2.pli: mātā rakkhati gopeti issariyaṃ kāreti vasaṃ vatteti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.2.eng: her mother protects, guards, wields authority, controls.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.3.eng: The one protected by her father:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.4.pli: pitā rakkhati gopeti issariyaṃ kāreti vasaṃ vatteti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.4.eng: her father protects, guards, wields authority, controls.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.5.eng: The one protected by her parents:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.6.pli: mātāpitaro rakkhanti gopenti issariyaṃ kārenti vasaṃ vattenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.6.eng: her parents protect, guard, wield authority, control.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.7.eng: The one protected by her brother:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.8.pli: bhātā rakkhati gopeti issariyaṃ kāreti vasaṃ vatteti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.8.eng: her brother protects, guards, wields authority, controls.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.9.eng: The one protected by her sister:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.10.pli: bhaginī rakkhati gopeti issariyaṃ kāreti vasaṃ vatteti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.10.eng: her sister protects, guards, wields authority, controls.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.11.eng: The one protected by her relatives:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.12.pli: ñātakā rakkhanti gopenti issariyaṃ kārenti vasaṃ vattenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.12.eng: her relatives protect, guard, wield authority, control.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.13.eng: The one protected by her family:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.14.pli: sagottā rakkhanti gopenti issariyaṃ kārenti vasaṃ vattenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.14.eng: her family protects, guards, wields authority, controls.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.15.eng: The one protected by her religion:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.16.pli: sahadhammikā rakkhanti gopenti issariyaṃ kārenti vasaṃ vattenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.16.eng: her fellow believers protect, guard, wield authority, control.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.17.comm: Sp 1.303: Saha ārakkhenāti sārakkhā, “Sārakkha means having protection.” Sp-ṭ 1.303: Sasāmikā sārakkhā; “Sārakkhā means having a husband.” But it clearly does not mean marriage in a modern sense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.18.pli: gabbhepi pariggahitā hoti— mayhaṃ esāti. Antamaso mālāguḷaparikkhittāpi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.18.eng: even in the womb someone takes possession of her, thinking, “She is mine,” and so too for one engaged to be married.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.19.eng: The one protected by the threat of punishment:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.20.pli: kehici daṇḍo ṭhapito hoti—yo itthannāmaṃ itthiṃ gacchati ettako daṇḍoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.2.20.eng: those who punish will punish anyone going to her with a fixed punishment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.3.2.eng: after buying her with money, they live together.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.3.4.eng: being dear to each other, they live together.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.3.6.eng: after giving property, they live together.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.3.8.eng: after giving clothes, they live together.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.3.9.eng: The wife through the bowl-of-water ritual:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.3.10.eng: after touching a bowl of water, they live together.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.3.10.comm: Sp 1.303: Odapattakinīti ubhinnaṁ ekissā udakapātiyā hatthe otāretvā “idaṁ udakaṁ viya saṁsaṭṭhā abhejjā hothā”ti vatvā pariggahitāya vohāranāmametaṁ, niddesepissa “tāya saha udakapattaṁ āmasitvā taṁ vāsetī”ti evamattho veditabbo; “Odapattakinī: this is an expression for both having entered their hand into a single bowl of water, saying, for the purpose of taking possession, ʻMay you not be split but be together like this water.’ Also, it may be specified like this: ʻAfter touching the bowl of water with you, he lives with you.’ The meaning is to be understood in this way.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.3.11.eng: The wife through removing the head pad:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.3.12.eng: after removing the head pad, they live together.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.3.12.comm: Sp 1.303: Obhaṭaṁ oropitaṁ cumbaṭamassāti obhaṭacumbaṭā, kaṭṭhahārikādīnaṁ aññatarā, yassā sīsato cumbaṭaṁ oropetvā ghare vāseti, tassā etaṁ adhivacanaṁ; “Obhaṭacumbaṭā: her head pad, which is for carrying sticks, etc., has been removed. This is a term for one who is made to live in a house (with another), after removing the cloth pad from her head.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.3.14.eng: she is a slave and a wife.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.3.16.eng: she is a servant and a wife.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.3.18.eng: one brought back as a captive is what is meant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.3.20.eng: a wife for one occasion is what is meant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.0.2.eng: Acting as a matchmaker for a man and a single bought wife

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.1.eng: A man sends a monk, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.2.eng: “Sir, go to so-and-so protected by her mother and say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.3.eng: ‘Please be the bought wife of so-and-so.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.4.eng: If he accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.5.eng: A man sends a monk, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.6.eng: “Sir, go to so-and-so protected by her father and say …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.7.eng: so-and-so protected by her parents and say …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.8.eng: so-and-so protected by her brother and say …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.9.eng: so-and-so protected by her sister and say …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.10.eng: so-and-so protected by her relatives and say …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.11.eng: so-and-so protected by her family and say …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.12.eng: so-and-so protected by her religion and say …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.14.eng: so-and-so protected by the threat of punishment and say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.15.eng: ‘Please be the bought wife of so-and-so.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.16.eng: If he accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.17.eng: The setting out of the steps is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.18.0.eng: Acting as a matchmaker for a man and two bought wives

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.18.1.eng: A man sends a monk, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.19.eng: “Sir, go to so-and-so protected by her mother and so-and-so protected by her father and say,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.19.comm: At first glance the Pali seems to concern a single wife who is protected in two ways, not two separate wives. However, since the immediately following question is phrased in the plural, hotha … bhariyāyo dhanakkītā, “please be the bought wives,” it is clear that this is about two wives. To bring this out in translation, I have added “so-and-so” to each potential wife.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.20.eng: ‘Please be the bought wives of so-and-so.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.21.eng: If he accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.22.eng: A man sends a monk, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.23.eng: “Sir, go to so-and-so protected by her mother and so-and-so protected by her parents …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.24.eng: so-and-so protected by her mother and so-and-so protected by her brother …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.25.eng: so-and-so protected by her mother and so-and-so protected by her sister …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.26.eng: so-and-so protected by her mother and so-and-so protected by her relatives …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.27.eng: so-and-so protected by her mother and so-and-so protected by her family …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.28.eng: so-and-so protected by her mother and so-and-so protected by her religion …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.29.eng: so-and-so protected by her mother and so-and-so otherwise protected …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.30.eng: so-and-so protected by her mother and so-and-so protected by the threat of punishment and say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.31.eng: ‘Please be the bought wives of so-and-so.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.32.eng: If he accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.33.eng: The unconnected permutation series is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.33.comm: For an explanation of these sectional summaries, see Appendix of Specialized Vocabulary under khaṇḍa and cakka.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.34.eng: A man sends a monk, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.35.eng: “Sir, go to so-and-so protected by her father and so-and-so protected by her parents and say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.36.eng: ‘Please be the bought wives of so-and-so.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.37.eng: If he accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.38.eng: A man sends a monk, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.39.eng: “Sir, go to so-and-so protected by her father and so-and-so protected by her brother …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.40.eng: so-and-so protected by her father and so-and-so protected by her sister …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.41.eng: so-and-so protected by her father and so-and-so protected by her relatives …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.42.eng: so-and-so protected by her father and so-and-so protected by her family …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.43.eng: so-and-so protected by her father and so-and-so protected by her religion …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.44.eng: so-and-so protected by her father and so-and-so otherwise protected …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.45.eng: so-and-so protected by her father and so-and-so protected by the threat of punishment and say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.46.eng: ‘Please be the bought wives of so-and-so.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.47.eng: If he accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.48.eng: A man sends a monk, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.49.eng: “Sir, go to so-and-so protected by her father and so-and-so protected by her mother and say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.50.eng: ‘Please be the bought wives of so-and-so.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.51.eng: If he accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.52.eng: The linked permutation series with the basis in brief is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.52.comm: See Appendix of Specialized Vocabulary under baddha, cakka, mūla and, saṅkhitta.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.53.eng: … A man sends a monk, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.54.eng: “Sir, go to so-and-so protected by the threat of punishment and so-and-so protected by her mother and say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.55.eng: ‘Please be the bought wives of so-and-so.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.56.eng: If he accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.57.eng: A man sends a monk, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.58.eng: “Sir, go to so-and-so protected by the threat of punishment and so-and-so protected by her father …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.59.eng: so-and-so protected by the threat of punishment and so-and-so protected by her parents …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.60.eng: so-and-so protected by the threat of punishment and so-and-so protected by her brother …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.61.eng: so-and-so protected by the threat of punishment and so-and-so protected by her sister …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.62.eng: so-and-so protected by the threat of punishment and so-and-so protected by her relatives …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.63.eng: so-and-so protected by the threat of punishment and so-and-so protected by her family …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.64.eng: so-and-so protected by the threat of punishment and so-and-so protected by her religion …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.65.eng: so-and-so protected by the threat of punishment and so-and-so otherwise protected and say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.66.eng: ‘Please be the bought wives of so-and-so.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.67.eng: If he accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.68.eng: The section based on one item is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.68.comm: See Appendix of Specialized Vocabulary under mūlaka.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.69.0.eng: Acting as a matchmaker for a man and three to nine bought wives

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.69.1.pli: Evaṃ dumūlakampi timūlakampi yāva navamūlakaṃ kātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.69.1.eng: The sections based on two items, three items, up to nine items, are to be done in the same way.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.70.0.eng: Acting as a matchmaker for a man and ten bought wives

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.70.1.eng: This is the section based on ten items:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.71.eng: A man sends a monk, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.72.pli: “gaccha, bhante, itthannāmaṃ māturakkhitañca piturakkhitañca mātāpiturakkhitañca bhāturakkhitañca bhaginirakkhitañca ñātirakkhitañca gottarakkhitañca dhammarakkhitañca sārakkhañca saparidaṇḍañca brūhi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.72.eng: “Sir, go to so-and-so protected by her mother and so-and-so protected by her father and so-and-so protected by her parents and so-and-so protected by her brother and so-and-so protected by her sister and so-and-so protected by her relatives and so-and-so protected by her family and so-and-so protected by her religion and so-and-so otherwise protected and so-and-so protected by the threat of punishment and say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.73.eng: ‘Please be the bought wives of so-and-so.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.74.eng: If he accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.4.75.eng: The permutation series on bought wives is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.5.0.eng: Acting as a matchmaker for a man and other kinds of wives

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.5.1.eng: A man sends a monk, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.5.2.eng: “Sir, go to so-and-so protected by her mother and say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.5.3.eng: ‘Please be the wife by choice of so-and-so.’” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.5.4.eng: the wife through property of so-and-so.’” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.5.5.eng: the wife through clothes of so-and-so.’” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.5.6.eng: the wife through the bowl-of-water ritual of so-and-so.’” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.5.7.eng: the wife through removing the head pad of so-and-so.’” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.5.12.eng: If he accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.5.13.0.eng: Acting as a matchmaker for a man and a single momentary wife

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.5.13.1.eng: A man sends a monk, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.5.14.eng: “Sir, go to so-and-so protected by her father and say …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.5.22.eng: so-and-so protected by the threat of punishment and say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.7.16.eng: ‘Please be the bought wives and the wives by choice and the wives through property and the wives through clothes and the wives through the bowl-of-water ritual and the wives through removing the head pad and the slave wives and the servant wives and the captured wives and the momentary wives of so-and-so.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.11.91.eng: his momentary wife and his wife by choice.” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.11.92.eng: his momentary wife and his captured wife.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.11.93.eng: If he accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.11.94.eng: The section based on one item is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.11.95.0.eng: The one protected by the threat of punishment taking the initiative: three to nine reasons

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.11.95.1.eng: The sections based on two items, etc., are to be done in the same way.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.11.96.0.eng: The one protected by the threat of punishment taking the initiative: ten reasons

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.11.96.1.eng: This is the section based on ten items:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.11.97.eng: The one protected by the threat of punishment sends a monk, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.11.99.pli: ‘homi itthannāmassa bhariyā dhanakkītā ca chandavāsinī ca bhogavāsinī ca paṭavāsinī ca odapattakinī ca obhaṭacumbaṭā ca dāsī ca bhariyā ca kammakārī ca bhariyā ca dhajāhaṭā ca muhuttikā cā’”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.11.99.eng: that I’ll be his bought wife and his wife by choice and his wife through property and his wife through clothes and his wife through the bowl-of-water ritual and his wife through removing the head pad and his slave wife and his servant wife and his captured wife and his momentary wife.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.11.100.eng: If he accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.11.101.eng: The further permutation series on the one protected by the threat of punishment is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.11.102.eng: The whole successive permutation series is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.12.1.eng: If he accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.12.2.pli: Paṭiggaṇhāti vīmaṃsati na paccāharati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.12.2.eng: If he accepts the mission, and finds out the response, but does not report back, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.12.3.pli: Paṭiggaṇhāti na vīmaṃsati paccāharati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.12.3.eng: If he accepts the mission, but does not find out the response, yet reports back, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.12.4.pli: Paṭiggaṇhāti na vīmaṃsati na paccāharati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.12.4.eng: If he accepts the mission, but neither finds out the response, nor reports back, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.12.5.pli: Na paṭiggaṇhāti vīmaṃsati paccāharati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.12.5.eng: If he does not accept the mission, yet finds out the response and reports back, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.12.6.pli: Na paṭiggaṇhāti vīmaṃsati na paccāharati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.12.6.eng: If he does not accept the mission, yet finds out the response, but does not report back, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.12.7.pli: Na paṭiggaṇhāti na vīmaṃsati paccāharati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.12.7.eng: If he neither accepts the mission, nor finds out the response, yet reports back, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.12.8.pli: Na paṭiggaṇhāti na vīmaṃsati na paccāharati, anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.12.8.eng: If he does not accept the mission, nor finds out the response, nor reports back, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.13.1.eng: A man tells a number of monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.13.2.eng: “Venerables, find out about such-and-such a woman.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.13.3.pli: Sabbe paṭiggaṇhanti sabbe vīmaṃsanti sabbe paccāharanti, āpatti sabbesaṃ saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.13.3.eng: If they all accept the mission, all find out the response, and all report back, they all commit an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.13.4.eng: A man tells a number of monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.13.5.eng: “Venerables, find out about such-and-such a woman.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.13.6.pli: Sabbe paṭiggaṇhanti sabbe vīmaṃsanti ekaṃ paccāharāpenti, āpatti sabbesaṃ saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.13.6.eng: If they all accept the mission, all find out the response, but only one reports back, they all commit an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.13.7.eng: A man tells a number of monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.13.8.eng: “Venerables, find out about such-and-such a woman.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.13.9.pli: Sabbe paṭiggaṇhanti ekaṃ vīmaṃsāpetvā sabbe paccāharanti, āpatti sabbesaṃ saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.13.9.eng: If they all accept the mission, but only one finds out the response, yet all report back, they all commit an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.13.10.eng: A man tells a number of monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.13.11.eng: “Venerables, find out about such-and-such a woman.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.13.12.pli: Sabbe paṭiggaṇhanti ekaṃ vīmaṃsāpetvā ekaṃ paccāharāpenti, āpatti sabbesaṃ saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.13.12.eng: If they all accept the mission, but only one finds out the response, and only one reports back, they all commit an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.14.2.eng: “Sir, find out about such-and-such a woman.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.14.3.eng: If he accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.14.5.eng: “Sir, find out about such-and-such a woman.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.14.6.pli: Paṭiggaṇhāti vīmaṃsati antevāsiṃ paccāharāpeti, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.14.6.eng: If he accepts the mission, finds out the response, but gets a pupil to report back, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.14.8.eng: “Sir, find out about such-and-such a woman.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.14.9.pli: Paṭiggaṇhāti antevāsiṃ vīmaṃsāpetvā attanā paccāharati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.14.9.eng: If he accepts the mission, but gets a pupil to find out the response, and then reports back himself, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.14.11.eng: “Sir, find out about such-and-such a woman.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.14.12.pli: Paṭiggaṇhāti antevāsiṃ vīmaṃsāpeti antevāsī vīmaṃsitvā bahiddhā paccāharati, āpatti ubhinnaṃ thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.14.12.eng: If he accepts the mission, but gets a pupil to find out the response, and the pupil then reports back on his own initiative, they both commit a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.15.1.pli: Gacchanto sampādeti, āgacchanto visaṃvādeti, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.15.1.eng: If he fulfills the agreement when he goes, but not when he returns, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.15.2.pli: Gacchanto visaṃvādeti, āgacchanto sampādeti, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.15.2.eng: If he does not fulfill the agreement when he goes, but he does when he returns, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.15.3.pli: Gacchanto sampādeti, āgacchanto sampādeti, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.15.3.eng: If he fulfills the agreement both when he goes and when he returns, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.15.4.eng: If he neither fulfills the agreement when he goes nor when he returns, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.16.2.pli: saṅghassa vā cetiyassa vā gilānassa vā karaṇīyena gacchati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.16.2.eng: if he goes because of business for the Sangha, for a shrine, or for one who is sick;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.16.4.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.16.7.eng: Not a woman, a woman who lacks sexual organs;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:4.16.9.eng: And he was a matchmaker for paṇḍakas.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro puriso aññataraṃ bhikkhuṃ āṇāpesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.1.1.eng: At one time a man told a monk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.1.2.eng: “Sir, please find out about such-and-such a woman.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.1.3.eng: When the monk got there, he asked some people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.1.7.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a training rule.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.1.8.pli: kacci nu kho ahaṃ saṅghādisesaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.1.8.eng: Could it be that I’ve committed an offense entailing suspension?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.1.9.eng: He told the Buddha, who said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.1.11.eng: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro puriso aññataraṃ bhikkhuṃ āṇāpesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.2.1.eng: At one time a man told a monk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.2.2.eng: “Sir, please find out about such-and-such a woman.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.2.3.eng: When the monk got there, he asked some people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.2.8.eng: “That’s a woman who lacks sexual organs, venerable.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.2.11.eng: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā itthī sāmikena saha bhaṇḍitvā mātugharaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.3.1.eng: At one time a certain woman quarreled with her husband and went to her mother’s house.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.3.2.eng: A monk who associated with that family reconciled them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.3.6.eng: “There’s no offense if they’re not divorced.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu paṇḍake sañcarittaṃ samāpajji.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.4.1.eng: At one time a monk acted as a matchmaker for paṇḍakas.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss5:5.4.5.eng: The training rule on matchmaking, the fifth, is finished.
